speaker: Martin
text: You know what I could go for?  Some fried eggs and bacon.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_handing him a bowl_] Here's your bran flakes.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, fine! _They then go through a morning regime.  Daphne opens the fridge. As Martin takes something off the top shelf, she takes something off the bottom shelf, then vice versa.  Martin then picks up the toast as it pops out, exclaiming "Oh hot!" and slamming it down on a plate that Daphne is holding next to the toaster - their timing seems perfect. Daphne then walks into the living room as Eddie barks at Martin._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_calling_] Don't give him any toast!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not! _Martin throws Eddie a toast point, then walks into the room and sits down at the table with Daphne.  Throughout this next little bit, Martin and Daphne are spreading butter and adding sugar without even looking. Firstly, Martin gets the paper and splits it up._

speaker: Martin
text: [_giving Daphne paper_] Lifestyle. [_giving himself paper_] Sports. [_putting a huge chunk of paper on table_] And recycling.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, we see you, Eddie - 8:00 on the dot.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, he's a dog, what do you expect?  He's a creature of habit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning, all. [_they ad-lib hellos, he heads into the kitchen_] Say, Dad.  You remember that woman I went out with on Valentine's Day but I wasn't quite sure if it was a romantic thing?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that new publicity woman at the station.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Cassandra Stone.  Well, I asked her out again last night and I got my answer.

speaker: Martin
text: [_concluded_] Oh, I'm sorry, Fras'.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm not finished!

speaker: Martin
text: That's the spirit.  You hang in there.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Dr. Crane, someone once said that long periods of abstinence can actually refresh the soul.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Morning, everyone!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well that someone was me and I was full of it! Everyone, this is Cassandra.

speaker: Cassandra
text: You must be Frasier's dad.  I've heard all about you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shaking her hand_] Marty Crane.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Nice to meet you!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, nice to meet YOU too!

speaker: Cassandra
text: You are so cute!  Now I see where Frasier got those gorgeous eyes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] Enough.  This is Daphne Moon - my father's home health care worker. [_Daphne extends her hand_]

speaker: Cassandra
text: [_quickly_] Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you going to join us for breakfast, Cassandra?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Oh, I could go for an English muffin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps our own English muffin could fetch that for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Or I could get it-

speaker: Cassandra
text: No, I'll get it myself.

speaker: Martin
text: Way to go, Fras, I like her!

speaker: Daphne
text: Gee, I wonder why. [_mimicking_] "Now I see where Frasier gets those gorgeous eyes."  [_N.B. Daphne's attempts at an American accent are the subject of comedy in previous episodes like[[1.21]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_21/travels_with_martin.html "Travels With Martin") "Travels With Martin" and [[4.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_19/three_dates_and_a_break_up_1.html "Three Dates And A Break Up \[1\]") "Three Dates & A Breakup," but here Jane Leeves does it fairly effortlessly.  See also [[7.11]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_11/the_fight_before_christmas_2.html "The Fight Before Christmas \[2\]") "The Fight Before Christmas."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering_] Hurry up and get dressed Frasier, we'll lose our court. I must warn you I may be unbeatable today. Our squash pro, Octavio, taught me a backhand slice that could shave the bristles off a kiwi fruit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Niles, I'm afraid we may have to reschedule today. You see, I... [_innuendo_] had a date last night.

speaker: Niles
text: [_concluding_] Oh, I'm sorry!  Hey, but there's no sense moping around.  A brisk game of squash would be the best thing for you - I can't think of a better way to lift your spirits.

speaker: Cassandra
text: [_enters from kitchen_] Good morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] Keep thinking. **OF ALL THE COFFEE JOINTS IN ALL THE TOWNS IN ALL THE WORLD...**  _Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. Later that day, Roz and Frasier are in the cafe chatting about last night._

speaker: Frasier
text: I tell you, Roz, the entire evening was pure magic.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm happy for you.  You have been in a dry spell, haven't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, Roz, that was just the calm before the storm. I assure you, we are in the midst of a full-blown love hurricane. [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: You were so much easier to be around when you were horny and pathetic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, sorry Roz, I have been monopolizing the conversation. So what's going on with you?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, actually it has been a really exciting week.  Of course Alice's first birthday party is this Sunday and we're having twelve of her little friends over.  She loves bears, so the whole party's going to be this bear theme - party favours, bear cake; I'm going to dress up like a bear, I think, and do a little bear dance...

speaker: Roz
text: So, that's really great about you and Cassandra!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excited_] Yes, we're really hitting it off, I think...

speaker: Faye
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Faye.

speaker: Faye
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, wow.  Hi, it's been a while.  Gosh, Faye Moskowitz, this is my producer, Roz Doyle. [_they ad-lib hellos_] So what have you been up to?

speaker: Faye
text: Well, I just got back from Paris.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I didn't even know you'd gone.

speaker: Faye
text: You didn't get my message?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh Frasier, before I forget: Faye called - she's going to France for a month.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, it's great to see you.  We should get together for coffee sometime.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd love to.

speaker: Roz
text: [_getting up_] Well I'm on my way out, why don't you take my seat?

speaker: Faye
text: Uh, thanks. [_to Frasier_] If that's all right with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Faye
text: Great, well I'll put some money into my meter.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing?!  I can't have coffee with her.

speaker: Roz
text: Why not?  Obviously she's still interested.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm seeing Cassandra, for God's sakes.  I can't date two people at once.

speaker: Roz
text: It doesn't have to be on the same night.  Although if you're good at faking a headache and you don't mind getting changed in the car...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, did you tell Cassandra you were going to be exclusive to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: No...

speaker: Roz
text: So, then you're just dating.  Relax, it's supposed to be fun. Just see where it takes you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that sort of lifestyle is all right for some people, but not for me.  I'm a one-woman man... if that!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, suit yourself - keep it platonic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's easy for you to say.  How do you tell somebody that you're attracted to them but you just can't sleep with them?

speaker: Roz
text: I guess you just say... you just say... I'll ask around.  _Roz exits the caf e.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. It's the following morning when Daphne and Martin enter the kitchen again._

speaker: Martin
text: You know what I feel like this morning?  Some French toast and sausage patties.

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's your bran flakes.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, fine.  _Daphne and Martin go through the same regime as they did in Scene One.  Everything goes identically - even Martin feeding Eddie some toast to which Daphne shouts:_

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not giving him any toast, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Of course not.  _Daphne and Martin enter the room to greet Frasier who is again dressed in his robe.  Again he goes to the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Morning.

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't hear you come in last night.  You have a date?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I guess that answers that.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, ease up there, Cassandra's a great gal - women like her don't come along every day.

speaker: Faye
text: Morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, they certainly don't!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Daphne, you remember Faye.

speaker: Faye
text: Hi Martin, it's good to see you again.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, likewise.

speaker: Faye
text: And Daphne, you look gorgeous.  Did you get your hair cut since the last time I saw you?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_overwhelmed by compliments_] Well, yes I did.  Can I fix you some breakfast?

speaker: Faye
text: I have really got to run.  I'm running late and I still have to call my friend at the museum to get tickets for that Seurat exhibit.  I just hope it's not sold out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well if it is: Que Seurat, Seurat. [_laughs_]

speaker: Faye
text: That was funnier the first time!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah. [_they kiss_]

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to Cassandra?

speaker: Daphne
text: Obviously he dumped her for someone better.

speaker: Frasier
text: I haven't dumped anyone.

speaker: Daphne
text: What, you mean you're dating both of them?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I didn't intend to.  It's just that - well, I ran into Faye yesterday and I was about to tell her about Cassandra. It's just that we were enjoying our coffee so much that coffee turned into dinner, and then dinner turned into drinks, and then drinks turned into, well... coffee again!  _The doorbell sounds.  Frasier walks to the door carrying two full cups of coffee._

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn!  I completely forgot I rescheduled squash with Niles. [_shouts through door_] Don't be angry at me for still being in my robe.  _However when he opens the door it's Cassandra who's popped in on her way to work._

speaker: Cassandra
text: I won't, I wish I were in mine!

speaker: Frasier
text: Cassandra. [_worried_] What a surprise.

speaker: Cassandra
text: I brought you some pastries.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, isn't that thoughtful of you. [_takes them_]

speaker: Cassandra
text: [_enters_] Hi Martin, Dixie.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_before Daphne erupts_] Cassandra!  You know, I'd love it if you could stay; [_guides her back to the door_] It's just that I've got to go and pick up my brother for a game of squash.

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters_] Morning, all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, isn't that a timesaver!  You know, I've still got to go get dressed anyway, [_opens door; hopefully_] and I'll just see you back at the station?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Okay, alright, have a good day. [_just then_] Oh, you know, I'll just use the powder room.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering_] This is a disaster!

speaker: Niles
text: What is?

speaker: Faye
text: Hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm up to speed!

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, I guess I'll just be...

speaker: Faye
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, we just noticed there's a nest of baby hummingbirds on the balcony.  And we're just keeping our voices down.  You run along.

speaker: Faye
text: [_skeptical_] Hummingbirds made it to the 19th floor?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well they're-they're Himalayan mountain hummers.

speaker: Faye
text: Uh huh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very rare.  Bye bye.

speaker: Faye
text: Okay, I'll see you later, Frasier. [_they kiss_] _Faye finally leaves through the front door.  Frasier stands there in relief after the two women are kept apart.  However at that moment, Cassandra opens the powder room door which slams right into Frasier._

speaker: Cassandra
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] I was just standing guard.  The door is... lock's broken and sometimes Dad just wanders in.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Well, I know you've got your game so I'll just get out of your hair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Goodbye, everyone.  _Cassandra about to leave but Frasier looks through the spy hole in the door and sees Faye still waiting for the elevator._

speaker: Frasier
text: Aren't I going to get a hug first?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Of course.  _Frasier basically pins her against the door as he takes another look through the spy hole._

speaker: Cassandra
text: Are you alright?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, it's just so hard to say goodbye to you. _He sees Faye getting into the lift and the doors closing.  He releases Cassandra._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, time's a wasting, off you go, bye-bye!

speaker: Niles
text: Got anymore hiding in the grotto, Hef?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sakes... oh, I'm just not up to this sort of thing - what made me think I could juggle?

speaker: Martin
text: I sure as hell don't know - you couldn't catch a balloon 'til you were ten.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thank you, Dad!  You see, my problem is that each of them appeals to different sides of my personality.  Faye is artistic and cerebral and cultured, and Cassandra is passionate and fun and spontaneous.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, my vote sure goes for Cassandra.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you would say that.  Any young woman who shows you any attention, you're ready to sign over your pension check! I think he should go for Faye.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Faye, Faye - if he wants some boring, artsy-fartsy conversation, he's got Niles!  _Daphne nods in agreement with this sentence as Niles just stares at him until Frasier breaks the ice:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well my point is that I'm really torn here.  I feel as if I honestly cannot choose.

speaker: Niles
text: I think I might be able to help you with this. [_takes out a quarter_] Heads, it's Faye; Tails, Cassandra.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh, this is the sort of thing that makes a woman feel really special!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you're actually going to flip a coin?  The decision cannot be made that simply.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's not going to be that simple.  The chances of Niles catching that quarter are about the same as you...

speaker: Frasier
text: Enough, Dad!

speaker: Niles
text: Just go with me on this, Frasier.  Heads, it's Faye; tails, Cassandra.  _He is about to flip the coin when he notices Martin and Daphne looking at him waiting for him to drop it.  Niles decides he can better them and takes the coin straight to the back of his hand._

speaker: Niles
text: And the winner is... [_points at Frasier_] Admit it!  You want me to say one name more than the other.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you're right, I do - Cassandra.

speaker: Martin/Daphne
text: [_raising his arms_] Yes!/Oh!

speaker: Niles
text: There you have it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, thank you, Niles.  Wow, what a relief.  You know, my life was perfectly happy before Faye came back, you know? Yes, yes, it's Cassandra - she's the one.  Next time I see Faye I'll just have to tell her it's over.  Oh gosh, Niles, I'm sorry - I'm afraid we've lost our court again.  Do you mind if we reschedule it just once more?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, that's fine.

speaker: Martin
text: I've got to hand it to you, Frasier.  You had a tough decision to make, but you made it.  Heck, I can't even decide whether to have the strawberry or the grape jelly.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Dad, I stil have my trusty quarter.  Let's say heads, grape; tails, strawberry. _Niles flips the coin and it smacks him right between the eyes. He falls over in pain, taking half of Frasier's ornaments with him as he goes._

speaker: Martin
text: [_shaking his head_] You've got to wonder what goes on, on that squash court.  _Daphne nods in agreement.  End Of Act One. (Time: 11:30)  Act Two.  Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. The following morning, identical to the first line of Act One, Martin and Daphne enter the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: You know what I could go for this morning?  A big old Spanish omelet.

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's your bran flakes. _However, this time Martin just stares at it.  He is upset because the bowl isn't his usual yellow one - it's red._

speaker: Martin
text: What's that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Your yellow bowl broke in the dishwasher.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, don't you have another one?

speaker: Daphne
text: Afraid not.

speaker: Martin
text: Well - red, yellow - what difference does it make? _Yet it does make a difference.  When Daphne opens the fridge they both go to the top shelf at the same time and hurt their heads.  They then do the same on the bottom shelf.  Then when Daphne shuts the fridge door she is still rubbing her head when Martin throws the toast out of the toaster.  It falls to the floor._

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't like this red bowl - it's thrown everything off!

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I think we do have another yellow bowl.  Why don't you go and sit down and I'll fetch it for you.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay. [_leaves_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_takes Eddie's bowl_] Back off, I need this! _As Daphne takes Eddie's bowl and begins to wash it, Martin enters the living room to find Frasier perched on the sofa arm._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, morning, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Everything go alright with Faye last night?  She didn't take the breakup too hard, did she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not really.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sure she realizes, pretty as she is, that she won't be alone for long.

speaker: Faye
text: Good morning, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: What'd I tell you? [_doorbell rings; to Faye_] Hi, how you doing?  I'll get this. _As he goes to the door, Faye drops her voice and playfully drums her fists on Frasier's chest._

speaker: Faye
text: I had an incredible time last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me too. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Niles
text: Morning, all! [_sees Frasier & Faye_] Oh, forget it.  _He leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. Later that day, Niles and Frasier are sitting down at the front table in the cafe.  They are discussing the morning._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles. [_sits down_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Glad you're here.  Look, I'm so sorry about this morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, not at all, I ended up playing an exhilarating game with Chip Emery.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: I won two out of three sets, and if you recall, Chip was club champion four years running.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and I also recall that that record comes with an asterisk: I believe his streak was interrupted by World War Two.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pouring milk into his coffee_] It was Korea and you know it!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Can I have my usual, please?

speaker: Niles
text: So why was Faye at your apartment this morning?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I almost made a terrible mistake.  Last night, I was prepared to break things off with her - and then suddenly we fell into this marvelous conversation about architecture. And as it turns out, she detests the design of the Bilbao art museum as much as I do.

speaker: Niles
text: [_understanding_] And you almost let her go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, exactly!  Well, you know, Cassandra is a wonderful woman. But, well, Faye and I have a, a deeper connection - and to be fair, actually, she was the first to plant her flag on "Terra Frasier."

speaker: Niles
text: I'm starting to think Napoleon had a Frasier complex.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, there's Cassandra.  I asked her here for coffee - I was going to tell her that we can't see each other any longer.

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting up_] Good luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, thank you, Niles.  _As Niles orders another coffee at the bar, Frasier calls Cassandra over and they sit at the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Cassandra.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Hi, honey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Cassandra
text: [_to waiter_] Double Espresso, please. [_to Frasier_] I have great news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Those new promos are working wonders.  I just got the numbers and you're really scoring with women between the ages of 25 and 49.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_breaking the ice_] Well, that's not always a good thing.

speaker: Cassandra
text: You alright?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I-I wanted to talk to you about our relationship. You see, I...

speaker: Cassandra
text: I know where we're going: a serious talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, there comes a time in every relationship when you have to decide...

speaker: Cassandra
text: I know, whether we're going to be exclusive or not.  I've been wanting to talk to you about that too.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_happy_] You have?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Yes.  You see, I thought you should know that I've been seeing someone else.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused_] Really?!

speaker: Cassandra
text: Does that bother you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, no, actually, not at all.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Oh, good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, what I wanted to say was that- [_still worried_] well, how long you been seeing this other fellow?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Not very long.  You're not upset, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, no.  Actually, I was about to say- well, uh, what does he do?

speaker: Cassandra
text: He owns his own venture capital firm.  Although he spends most of his time racing sail boats and rebuilding trails for the Sierra Club.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh really, seems a little unfocused, doesn't he?!  _Frasier angrily reaches for a plastic stirrer, and like a madman swirls his sugar into his coffee.  Cassandra picks up the signs._

speaker: Cassandra
text: You are upset, aren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, no.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Really, there's no reason to be jealous of Sloan!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] Believe me, I am not jealous of _Sloan!_ [_licking his stirrer_] If anything, I pity the man who has to go through life with a pretentious name like that!

speaker: Cassandra
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, fine, fine.  You know what, let's just drop the whole thing, alright?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Now, about those new promos....

speaker: Frasier
text: Cassandra, I want us to be exclusive!

speaker: Cassandra
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, I'm the kind of person who can make a decision and commit to it.  And I was hoping that you might be that sort of person too.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Frasier, I'm so touched.  If you only want us to be with each other - that's great.  I was supposed to see Sloan tonight, but I'm going to call him and cancel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's wonderful - oh my god, that means we can spend the night together.  _Frasier and Cassandra kiss as she leaves to call Sloan.  Niles comes over to the table, sees Frasier's ear-to-ear grin, and understands._

speaker: Niles
text: Looks like she took the news well - are you insane?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I almost made a terrible mistake.

speaker: Niles
text: What could possibly have happened in the last four minutes to make you change your mind again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, when Cassandra told me that she was seeing somebody else, it awakened something in me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, petty jealousy?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  The realization that I couldn't bear to lose her.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and the minute you see Faye you'll reverse yourself again!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I won't.  I'll prove it to you.  Cassandra is the one! I'm sure of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] Oh, her machine. [_into phone_] Yes, Faye - it's Frasier.  Uh, listen, I won't be able to join you for dinner tonight, but perhaps you could call me later - we need to talk. [_hangs up_] There, I've done it.  Nothing says, "It's over between us" quite like the phrase "we need to talk." You see, that was my problem, actually - I kept leaving the door open.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm very proud of you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: An enlightened man is he who can learn from his mistakes. Squash tomorrow morning?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nine AM, my place.

speaker: Niles
text: See you then. _Niles walks out of the caf e as Cassandra comes down after chatting with Sloan._

speaker: Cassandra
text: Well, I called him. [_sits with Frasier_] I probably should feel guilty but I'm just so glad it's just the two of us now.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm ecstatic.

speaker: Cassandra
text: I know a cute little bed-and-breakfast we can go to this weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?

speaker: Cassandra
text: [_to waiter bringing her coffee_] Thank you. _As Cassandra begins chatting to Frasier, he begins mentally reviewing the situation:_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] What a relief this is.  I've made my choice.  Look at her, I've found an angel... an angel who wears an awful lot of makeup.  I've never noticed that before.  Faye doesn't paint her face up like that.

speaker: Cassandra
text: And they have the cutest little four poster beds in each room.

speaker: Frasier
text: That sounds lovely. [_v.o_] My, she uses the word "cute" a lot.  I'm cute, this cafe is cute, now the bed is cute. Faye used the word "_jejeune_ " last night.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Oh, you know, I meant to tell you, I really liked how you handled that nasty caller yesterday.  It was such a clever way of...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] God, all she talks about is work, work, work.  And now I'll see her every morning before work, and at work, and after work.  I feel trapped!  Can't breathe... Wait! What are you doing?  It's just your fear talking.  She's a wonderful woman.  She's the one.  She's perfect!

speaker: Cassandra
text: And then I ran into Roz after the show, and she told me the cutest little story that...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_aloud_] Cassandra... we need to talk. _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Faye's Apartment. That evening, someone is frantically ringing the doorbell. Faye, wearing a short, tide-dyed t-shirt, answers the door._

speaker: Faye
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Faye, hi. [_enters_] Uh, look, we-we really need to talk.

speaker: Faye
text: I know, I got your message.  I thought you couldn't see me tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I just had some unfinished business with the promotions department, but that's all done now.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, I wish you would had called, I would have put something on. [_she pulls her t-shirt down_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, you look beautiful.  Listen, Faye: I-I want us to be exclusive.

speaker: Faye
text: [_surprised_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I want to take our relationship to the next level. I just want to be with you.

speaker: Faye
text: Wow.  I'm a little surprised.  You said "we need to talk" on the machine, and you know, that usually means it's over.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_acting the innocent_] Really?  I had no idea.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, this is wonderful!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, so it's just you and me.  God, this is exhilarating.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, this is turning out to be the best day ever.  Because, well, okay, Chris McKenna - the restaurant critic? - he comes over to the restaurant this morning and...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] What is she thinking with that ridiculous shirt? Tie-dyed?!  Stop it, Frasier.  You can't do this to yourself. This is nothing more than the natural panic of finally making your choice.

speaker: Faye
text: ...and it turned out that the printer had messed up, and the menu said "flab" instead of "flan!"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] That is so precious. [_v.o_] And so is she, precious. My Faye - Faye, as in _Faye_ -vourite.  This feels so much better now that I've relaxed.  I was about to doom this whole relationship with my neurotic nitpicking.  But it's clear sailing now.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, enough about me.  How was your day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it certainly ended well. [_she smiles and caresses his cheek_] Although something funny did happen at the station -- it was during the second hour of my show...

speaker: Faye
text: [_v.o_] My God, he really does love to talk about himself. [_glances down_] Is that another new pair of shoes?  He's got more shoes than I do! _Faye then decides it's best not to nitpick, and laughs at his joke as we FADE OUT._

speaker: Credits
text: Frasier's Apartment In the kitchen, Eddie doesn't seem to be touching his water. It is in the red bowl that Martin couldn't use at the start of Act Two.  So Daphne goes into the room to get Martin's yellow bowl that originally was Eddie's.  Martin refuses to give it to her until he eats his last bran flake. Daphne then rushes into the kitchen with it and fills it with water. She then lays it down in front of Eddie who merrily drinks from it.   * * *  ## Guest Appearances    **Special Guest Stars** VIRGINIA MADSEN as Cassandra AMY BRENNEMAN as Faye   * * *  ## Quick Synopsis {kathy churay}     _ACT ONE  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment - Morning_  Martin and Daphne are in the kitchen, maneuvering around one another with the balletic grace and split-second timing of long practice. They've obviously got it down to a science, including the same old ritual complaints and Martin feeding the dog a forbidden piece of toast.  They move to the living room with breakfast and Frasier emerges from his room in a cheerful mood.  He reveals that he has asked out Cassandra again, the same women he dated ambiguously in the Valentine's day episode.  Martin and Daphne jump to the obvious conclusion and start comforting him over his failed romance, only to be embarrassed when Cassandra herself emerges from the bedroom in a dressing gown.  She is full of flattery and compliments for Martin, who is thoroughly charmed, though she all but ignores Daphne. Frasier suggests Daphne make breakfast for Cassandra, but Daphne just glares and Cassandra goes off to the kitchen to make it herself as Daphne does a dead-on imitation of Cassandra's flattery, complete with American accent.  Niles comes to the door in his squash outfit, full of reproof for Frasier at not even being dressed for their game.  Frasier tells him they will have to reschedule because he had a date last night.  Niles too leaps to conclusions and starts comforting Frasier.  "A brisk game of squash will be the best thing for you.  I can't think of a better way to lift your spirits."  As Cassandra emerges from the kitchen, Frasier remarks dryly, "Keep thinking."   ****Of All The Coffee Joints In All The Towns In All The World...****   Frasier is having coffee with Roz and smugly recounting the latest chapter of his romance with Cassandra.  Roz is a bit nauseated by him but tries gamely to stay interested.  Finally Frasier asks about her life, and Roz excitedly tells him the plans for Alice's first birthday party the following Sunday.  Frasier just looks at her blankly and Roz gives up trying to keep his attention, changing the subject back to Frasier and his love life.  Just then Faye Moskowitz happens by.  Frasier greets her with a big hug and Faye tells him she just got back from a month in France.  She had left him a message but Roz forgot to deliver it.  Roz sees which way the wind is blowing and gets up to leave, giving her seat to Faye.  Faye happily accepts and goes outside to put money in her parking meter.  Frasier panics and says he can't have coffee with Faye because he's dating Cassandra.  Roz asks him whether he and and Cassandra have agreed to date each other exclusively, and Frasier has to admit they haven't.  In that case, Roz advises, he's under no obligation not to see other women, although he could keep things platonic with Faye if that would make him feel better.  He asks her how to tell Faye such a thing, but Roz has never had to do that and can't think of the words.    Martin and Daphne are making breakfast again, doing their usual graceful ballet around one another.  As they move to the breakfast table Frasier enters in his dressing gown, and Martin asks him if he had a date the night before.  In answer Frasier holds up two coffee cups instead of his usual one, and Martin compliments him on his choice of women.  "Women like Cassandra don't come along every day." Daphne is amused when the woman who comes out of the bedroom in one of Frasier's bathrobes is not Cassandra but Faye.  Faye greets them and compliments Daphne on her new haircut.  Daphne beams and offers to fix her breakfast, but Faye declines and heads for the bedroom to get dressed.  Frasier is following her with the coffee when the doorbell rings, and it's Cassandra with a bag of pastry.  Frasier nervously begs off and tells her that he has a squash game with Niles, so Cassandra starts to leave, only to make a side trip to the powder room.  Frasier grimly admits Niles, who has shown up for the rescheduled squash game.

speaker: Frasier
text: ****(sotto voce) "This is a disaster!"

speaker: Niles
text: **** "What is?"

speaker: Faye
text: ******(now fully dressed)  "Hi, Niles."

speaker: Niles
text: **** "Oh, I'm up to speed!"  Frasier hustles Faye quickly out of the apartment just in time as Cassandra exits the bathroom and tries to leave.  Frasier keeps hugging her and playing for time until he can see through the front door peephole that Faye has boarded the elevator and left  Then he practically shoves Cassandra out the door.  Niles teases him about his plethora of women and Frasier defends himself by saying that each of them appeals to a different side of his personality -- Cassandra to the passionate, earthy side and Faye to the cultural, arty side.  Martin makes it clear he prefers Cassandra and Daphne gives him a hard time about his susceptibility to flattery.  Niles attempts to help Frasier decide by offering to flip a coin, but stops at the last minute and forces Frasier to admit he wants one woman to be the winner of the coin toss.  Frasier finally comes clean -- Cassandra is the one he prefers, to Martin's delight and Daphne's consternation.  Martinc compliments Frasier on his ability to make a tough choice, saying that he himself can't decide between two kinds of jam.  Niles offers to help Martin decide and flips the coin, hitting himself in the head and causing one of his patented disastrous Niles pratfalls.  Martin and Daphne don't bat an eye.   _ACT TWO  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment - The Next Morning_  Martin and Daphne are doing their morning ballet, only this time Martin's favorite yellow cereal bowl has broken in the dishwasher and he has to use a different one.  This is enough to throw off his entire morning ritual, and he and Daphne keep bumping into one another till Daphne offers to find another yellow bowl somewhere around.  She pushes Martin out of the kitchen and grabs Eddie's yellow water bowl to give it a quick wash.  Martin asks Frasier how his breakup with Faye had gone the day before, but doesn't need to wonder for long as Faye once again appears in Frasier's bathrobe.  Niles shows up at the front door ready for squash, but promptly turns around and leaves in disgust when he sees Faye.    Niles is having coffee as Frasier bustles in to apologize for missing the squash game for the third time.  Niles is trying to understand Frasier's logic in spending the night with Faye, and Frasier explains that his conversation with Faye had just led him to understand that he and Faye had a deeper connection than with Cassandra.  In fact, he has asked Cassandra to meet him at the cafe so that he can tell her goodbye. Just then she comes into the cafe, and Niles makes himself scarce.  Cassandra sits down and Frasier begins the conversation tensely. Cassandra clearly thinks he's going to call things off and tells him not to feel bad -- she's been dating someone else.  Frasier tries to complete his speech but is badly thrown by Cassandra's news.  In fact, he's so overcome with jealousy that he ends up asking her to date him exclusively.  Cassandra is pleased and begins to chatter on happily, as in voiceover we hear Frasier's doubts begin to surface about her every little flaw.  She goes off to make a phone call to her other boyfriend and call off that evening's date,  and Niles comes over to the table, having seen the whole thing from across the room.  Niles gave Frasier a hard time about his sudden change of heart. Frasier, of course, insists that Cassandra is the only woman for him, and calls Faye his cell phone to break it off with her right then. She isn't home, so he leaves a message cancelling their dinner plans for that evening and telling her ominously, "We need to talk."  But as soon as Cassandra returns to the table his doubts return, and  he breaks things off with her.   Frasier comes to Faye's apartment and asks her to date him exclusively.  Faye is surprised and happy and tells him that she will.  They sit on the couch and Frasier's doubts begin running audibly through his mind again, only this time they were immediately followed by Faye's doubts about Frasier, which we can also hear. "Are those new shoes again?  He has more shoes than I do..."
